snippet: Nest Labs, a Silicon Valley start-up, is trying to transform the household thermostat into a digital assistant that reduces energy consumption.
abstract: Nest Labs, a Silicon Valley start-up, is trying to transform the household thermostat into a digital assistant that reduces energy consumption.

headline.main: Ex-Apple Leaders Push the Humble Thermostat Into the Digital Age
headline.print_headline: Ex-Apple Leaders Push Thermostats Into the Digital Age

snippet: Reed Hastings, the chief executive, talks about the missteps that cost subscribers and sent the stock plunging.
abstract: Reed Hastings, chief executive of Netflix, says missteps, including an unpopular price cut and a scrapped plan to divide into two companies, led to loss of 800,000 subscribers in the third quarter; company's stock plummets more than 25 percent on the news but performed well financially with a reported net income of $62.5 million, or $1.16 a share.

headline.main: How Netflix Lost 800,000 Members, and Good Will

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and BRIAN STELTER

headline.main: A Hearing Aid That Cuts Out All the Clatter
headline.print_headline: A Hearing Aid That Cuts Out All the Clatter

snippet: The road back for Nokia is going to be a long one, but many believe it will begin with the new smartphones bearing Microsoft's operating system to be introduced Wednesday.
abstract: Nokia faces long road ahead, with losses of $597 million in second and third quarters and nine-month smartphone market share loss of nearly half, to 15.5 percent in September; hopes are high for new smartphones with Microsoft's operating system.

headline.main: Crucial Test for Nokia as Latest Smartphones Arrive
headline.print_headline: Nokia, a Fallen Leader, Risks a Lot in Introducing Phones With Windows Software
